instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: Hello, the board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, it freezes once after a day or two, the trackpad is till working but is stuck with rainbow wheel. I tried without the pci ssd with external hdd with usb and it still freezes. The diagnostic while holding d at the start does not show any errors. Any ideas? Could it be the wifi board, or the lcd screen?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: Change FDMF6808 chips with real new FDMF6708; get them from Mouser...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: Does it restart at all or do you have to force restart it? Inspect board for corrosion first to rule out anything like that. If board is clean, then yeah best bet is to try replacing all the FDMF6808 controllers with NEW FDMF6708 chips from Mouser or Digikey. Make SURE you let the board cool or just UC it before firing it back up to test

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: ok thank you, i have ordered them, i will post back results when i have them. I need to force restart when it freezes and i have cleaned it, it had too much dust but not water damage anywhere.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: Yep sounds like those chips to me. Not a super fun repair, but it's worth a shot!

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message:
Remove the heatsink.
Best way to use a small preheater, like MLink 853A...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid-2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A freezing at random
threads.message: thank you guys, replaced with FDMF6708 and its working fine now, you can mark this as solved.
